commitResults.messageTitle: Level-0: Renamed the chatbot. and added greet and exit function
Level-1: Added echo function and customized the personality of the chatbox
Level-2: Added the ability to store text and show those stored text.
Level-3: Added the ability to mark and unmark tasks.
Level-4: Added 3 different type of tasks: Todos, Deadliens and Events
A-TextUiTesting: Added Some test cases for semi automated CLI testing.
Level-5: The chatbot can now handle common input error
Level-6: Added a delete function to remove task from list.
A-Enums: Change the command to enums.
Add separate files for the Task class and its subclasses
commitResults.messageBody:
The classes and functions are all written into the same file.

This makes it hard to maintain the clarity and understandbility of the code.

Separating the classes into different file helps to modularize the code and make them easier
to understand.

Let's start by creating separate files for the Task class and its subclasses

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove the corresponding code to the Task class and its subclasses
Separate OutputMessage and TaskList as a standalone class
Remove corresponding code to OutputMessage and TaskList from the original file
Make minor changes to test files to reflect the change in logo
Make a class for FileHandler and Command
commitResults.messageBody:
The code for command is in the same file as main.

This makes it to maintain as the number of commands increases.

Let's put it in a separate file to fix this issue.

This makes it easier to maintian the code base.

A file for FileHandler is also created to handle the file system of the app.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add the task list saving feature
Fix the bug of incorrecly displaying marked task as unmarked from the stored file
Clean up the output message for app
Merge branch 'branch-level-7'
Add Parser class for parsing string input and Command class and its subclasses
commitResults.messageBody:
Command class does parsing pass the comaand to the Tasklist to handle it.

This is not consistent with the class definition and makes it hard to add new
commands to the app.

Let's create a new Parse class that does the parsing. Additionally, lets create
an abstract Command class that can run a function by itself and make all the
previous commands into individual classes that extends of the Command class.

This allows for better abstraction and makes the code more extensible.

Let's also add the Local Date time capability into the parser.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add date and time recognition for tasks that take in date and time as input
Modify the input format and output format for date and time data to be different
Merge branch 'branch-Level-8'
Modify the code base to be more OOP oriented
commitResults.messageBody:
The code strucutre of Duke.java is adheres a lot more to functional programming.
With that said, the other parts of the code base follow OOP paradigm more.

As a result, there are inconsistencies in the main paradigm used by the code.

Let's restructure Duke.java to follow a more OOP approach. Additionally, let's rename
FileHandler to Storage and OutputMessage to Ui.

This can help to improve the consistency of the code base and increase its understandability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Integrate the Parser and Ui more effectively by outputing informative error message
Merge branch 'branch-A-MoreOOP'
Divide the classes into different packages
commitResults.messageBody:
All the class files are in the same file, classes with varying behaviour
and type are mixed into the same place.

This makes the codebase hard to manage as it grows larger.

To solve this issue, let's divide the all the class files into different
packages, by grouping similar classes into the same package.

This way, the code base becomes clearer and more understandable.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'add-gradle-support'
Add Gradle support to the program
Use Junit library to test a Parser, and a Storage method
commitResults.messageBody:
The program is tested manually and tested with a semi-automatic CLI
testing method which incorporate input/output redirection technique.

Manual testing can take a lot of time and CLI testing is limited in that
it cannot test each method separately, introducing the risk of missing
some bugs.

Let's use Junit library to unit test a few of the non-trivial method. We
first start with testing the crucial, parse method of the Parser class,
and the non trivial method of saving the file with each item added into
the list.

Using Junit can help to isolate and locate bugs in individual methods
more effectively. Additionally it can help to automate the test process,
saving a lot of time.

commitResults.messageTitle: Build a Jar Package using the shadowJar task from Gradle
